meanings.definition: To go or move to a place
meanings.sent1: I will betake myself to the park for a walk.
meanings.sent2: She decided to betake her umbrella when it started raining.
meanings.sent3: Let's betake to the kitchen and see what we can cook up!
meanings.sent4: The cat betook itself to the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent5: The lost hiker had to betake to the nearest shelter for safety.

meanings.definition: To resort or turn for help or support
meanings.sent1: When in trouble, he would always betake to his best friend for advice.
meanings.sent2: The villagers would betake to the wise old woman for solutions to their problems.
meanings.sent3: The student had to betake to the teacher for guidance on the difficult assignment.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, people often betake to prayer for comfort.
meanings.sent5: The injured bird betook itself to the animal shelter for care and healing.

meanings.definition: To commit or entrust to someone or something
meanings.sent1: She decided to betake her savings to a trusted financial advisor.
meanings.sent2: The king would betake important matters to his council for deliberation.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to betake the secret recipe to memory before it was lost.
meanings.sent4: The captain betook the safety of his crew to the sturdy ship in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The author betook the manuscript to the publisher with hopes of success.
